commentary_on_process:
To solve the problem, I carefully read through the given context and identified the relevant information. I then focused on the main question of the problem, which was asking for the number of times Alex Smith threw to Vernon Davis. I found that Alex Smith completed an 8-yard TD pass to Vernon Davis in the fourth quarter, which means that he threw to him only once. Therefore, the answer to the problem is 1.

Since the problem was straightforward and only required identifying a single instance of Alex Smith throwing to Vernon Davis, there was not much room for improvement in terms of solving the problem. However, if the problem had been more complex, I could have used a table or a chart to keep track of the number of times Alex Smith threw to different receivers, which would have made it easier to identify the number of times he threw to Vernon Davis.
problem_text:
Context:
Trying to end a three-game skid, the 49ers flew to Qwest Field for an NFC West rematch with the Seattle Seahawks on Thursday night.  In the first quarter, the Niners started off bumpy as Seahawks RB Shaun Alexander got a 3-yard TD run for Seattle's early strike and the only score of the period.  In the second quarter, San Francisco would get a field goal before halftime as kicker Joe Nedney nailed one from 39 yards out.  After a scorless third quarter, the Niners were in full force as QB Alex Smith completed an 8-yard TD pass to rookie TE Vernon Davis.  Afterwards, Smith would complete a 20-yard TD pass to RB Frank Gore.  Then, the 49ers wrapped the game up with Smith getting a very easy 18-yard QB sneak for a touchdown.  Seattle would get one more score as QB Matt Hasselbeck completed a 22-yard TD pass to TE Jerramy Stevens.  Fortunately, the Niners would get the win and the season sweep over the Seahawks.  With the win, the 49ers improved to 6-8

Question:
How many times did Alex Smith throw to Vernon Davis?
